column4: How can I fix my video drivers? I tried to install the latest version from nvidia and it completely hosed them, x won't start with them now.
nice, you broke it.
bullshit
no really. synaptic is a frontend to apt-get
nvidia's site, but then I used nvidia's uninstaller to remove them, then I reinstalled the ones from the repos
i didn't realize that's what you meant.
i reinstalled linux-restricted-modules and nvidia-glx-new (which was what was installed before)
i can't find anything in there through the sea of vesa garbage from the "failsafe" X GARBAGE in gutsy
starting the "bulletproof x" server creates a new log file...im not sure if it's Xorg.1.log, or 0.log..or 0.log.old...do a ls -al and see which log file is the 2nd latest, thats the one you want
found it, went through it, but it's all about vesa too.
/etc/init.d/gdm stop, killall gdm, killall Xorg, startx
grepped Xorg* for "nvidia" (ignoring case), nothing.
give that a shot, the log should have something about nvidia..if it doesnt...nvidia-xconfig i think will regenerate if if you just run as root
kernel module version mismatch
i reinstalled linux-restricted-modules-`uname -r` though.
no.
so where did the nvidia installer install nvidia.ko?
deleted 2 instances of nvidia.ko, reinstalled linux-restricted-modules and same error
version mismatch
reinstall the nvidia driver package in synaptic?
nope, didn't work.

i'm reinstalling everything, and going back to feisty. gutsy has been nothing but horrible experiences. tracker is broken. the nvidia driver version is broken. compositing literally works on maybe 0.5% of computers (mine works, but in general.)
